libs.Hotspot.scripts.new_examples¶

Version using the wrapper

Functions

create_original_flights([n_f])

example_agent_paradigm_approx([algo])

This is equivalent to the previous one, except the airlines provide some parameters that are used by the global engine, and not directly the cost vectors.

example_agent_paradigm_approx_alternate([algo])

Idem but with alternative rule for allocation

example_agent_paradigm_vect([algo])

This example follows a strong agent-based paradigm.

example_mercury_test_case([algo])

examples_direct_approx([algo])

These examples are similar to the previous ones, but they use approximated functions with an archetype.

examples_direct_cost_vector([algo])

These examples feature more direct computaion, to be used for instance for RL.

This example only works if you write the cost matrix down from Mercury, and copy/paste the slote times etc below
